examples: An ancient library floating among clouds, golden hour light streaming through massive windows, photorealistic
prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Text prompt describing the desired image. Supports Chinese and English. Max 2000 characters.

image_size.title: Image Size
image_size.description: Output image size. If not set: matches input image size (up to 1280*1280). Use presets like 'square_hd', 'landscape_16_9', or specify exact dimensions.

max_images.title: Max Images
max_images.description: Maximum number of images to generate (1-5). Actual count may be less depending on model inference.

image_url.title: Image Url
image_url.description: Optional reference image (0 or 1). When provided, can be used for style guidance. Resolution: 384-5000px each dimension. Max size: 10MB. Formats: JPEG, JPG, PNG (no alpha), BMP, WEBP.

enable_safety_checker.title: Enable Safety Checker
enable_safety_checker.description: Enable content moderation for input and output.

examples: low resolution, error, worst quality, low quality, deformed
negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt
negative_prompt.description: Content to avoid in the generated image. Max 500 characters.

input_schema.description: Input for Wan 2.6 text-to-image or mixed text-and-image generation (enable_interleave=true)
input_schema.title: TextToImageWanInput

generated_text.title: Generated Text
generated_text.description: Generated text content (in mixed text-and-image mode). May be None if only images were generated.

output_schema.description: Output for Wan 2.6 text-to-image (can include generated text in mixed mode)
output_schema.title: TextToImageWanOutput

height.title: Height
height.description: The height of the generated image.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the generated image.

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The mime type of the file.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
